meanings.definition: To exert force on (someone or something) so as to cause movement towards oneself.
meanings.sent1: She was pulling the heavy box across the floor.
meanings.sent2: The child was pulling the wagon up the hill.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was pulling on the leash, eager to explore the park.
meanings.sent4: The magnet seemed to be pulling the metal objects towards it.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind was pulling the kite high into the sky.

meanings.definition: To draw or haul towards oneself or itself, in a particular direction, or into a particular position.
meanings.sent1: He was pulling the curtains closed to block out the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The farmer was pulling the cart filled with hay.
meanings.sent3: The magician was pulling a rabbit out of the hat.
meanings.sent4: The tractor was pulling the plow through the field.
meanings.sent5: The fisherman was pulling the fishing net out of the water.

meanings.definition: To take hold of (something) and exert force in order to cause movement.
meanings.sent1: She was pulling the door handle to open the door.
meanings.sent2: The climber was pulling himself up the rock wall.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was pulling the cat's tail gently.
meanings.sent4: The gardener was pulling out the weeds from the flower bed.
meanings.sent5: The athlete was pulling the heavy sled during training.
